articles.title: China Coal-Fired Power Capacity Still Rising, Bucking Global Trend-Study - The New York Times
articles.description: China raised its coal-fired power capacity by 42.9 gigawatts (GW), or about 4.5%, in the 18 months to June, connecting new projects to the grid at a time when capacity in the rest of the world shrank, according to a study published on Wednesday.
articles.content:
Absolute coal consumption, however, has continued to increase in line with a rise in overall Chinese energy demand.
